It was a disappointment to me, and to John Crichton and Larry Reedy,
that the amount of time scheduled for presentation of national programs
left insufficient opportunity for proper discussion of the city-by-city
work being done by the fifty agencies involved in local Youth Opportunity
activitieso
However - we decided we will make a complete report of your work to
the press in the near future, and the subject of this news conference
solely will be the outstanding public service activities of the
Communications Coordinators. In line with this, we’d like to be able to
include a capsule report from each of you.
a) City-by-city activity
San Antonio, Texas Bernard M. Brooks Advertising
Four TV stations running continually one-minute spot by Mayor. Audio
used by 17 area radio stations, plus translated spot of three Spanish
stations. Specials: CBS station scheduled hour program on YO and NAB
objectives; NBC station programmed 10 thirty-minute programs on subjects.
Good publicity. Junior League manned job-solicitation telephones.
Detroit, Michigan Campbell-Ewald Company
Theme is "Detroit’s Happening," with "thumbs up" logo. Song,
"Detroit’s Happening" theme of TV and radio spots. With no dailies (strike),
public service advertising (What’s the Younger Generation Coming To? Youl)
ran in upwards of 75 area weeklies, 25 specialized publications and regional
issue of LIFE. Painted JOBS bulletin in high traffic location. JOBS bus
cards. TV stations programmed interviews and editorials. NBC station did
thirty-minute program on Youth Opportunity Summer Programs.
